TopicTitle: The terrain's messed up. Does anyone know what's causing this?

Articles.Content:
So, I had to transfer KSP to my new hard drive, but two directories got mixed up. I deleted the second directory's files.

When I started the game, it seemed normal, until I went near the beach.

Then the terrain went from being normal to THIS:

Does anyone know what's causing this? Here's the list of my mods:

Toolbar

Active Texture Management

American Pack

B9 Aerospace

BahaSP B9 lightning cockpit

BD armory

Bobcat's Home, Home 2, and Home 3

Burn Together

Clever Walrus

Cross Feed Enabler

Component Space Shuttle

DEMV Mk 2, 4, and 5

FASA

FAR

Firespitter

Hull camera VDS

ISS community

JSI

KAS

Hyperedit

KineTech animation

Klockheed Martian

Klockheed Martian Gimbal

LazTeck (All packages)

Infernal robotics

Mechjeb 2

Procedural Dynamics

ResGen

RN Skylab

Romfarer

Smoke Screen

Bobcat's Soviet pack (Mir, Soyuz, and Buran)

Texture replacer

Tweakscale

Virgin Kalactic

Vanguard Parachutes

I want to know if there's anything else to do besides re install the game.

Edited April 19, 2015 by Vanamonde
I dont know what did it but try redownloading ksp
Great! you can now explore what was the ocean floor!
In addition to redownloading KSP, try reinstalling your add-ons one by one to determine if there's an incompatibility that's causing the terrain issue.

As this is not a question about how to play the game, and the use of mods is a factor, this thread has been moved to Modded Support. Please note that you will need to provide additional information before anyone can give you an informed reply.
I had this... Simply getting a new settings.cfg fixed that for me
